result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L C Simpkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles L C Simpkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles L C Simpkins was found guilty of Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; argument by Atty Breun for bond modification; Ct questions counsel; counsel responds; objection to bond modification by ADA McMiller; rebuttal by Atty Breun; Ct does a BMP Referral.
referral form to bail monitoring

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT REFERRED TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $500 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case. 
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Shannon P. or A.J.D. 
- Defendant shall not be within 1 mile of 1100 block of Park Cir in Sun Prairie, WI.
- Defendant shall abide by the Injunction issued in Dane County Case No. 15CV1804.
